title: Annotation for different tasks in same project
body:
Feature description
---------
<!-- Please describe the feature: Which area of the library is it related to? What specific solution would you like? -->

Hi guys, I'm a new doccano's user, so, I don't know if there's a way to do that currently.

I'm a Data Scientist that works with NLP projects and is very common to have more than one task in the same dataset. I want to use Doccano to manage my data labeling step, but it's required that I created one project for each task. Let me explain with an example:

Text message: **"This is a stupid example, so thank you for nothing a!@#!@."**

For this text message, I can have several tasks.

- It's offensive or not? (Yes/No) - Binary classification
- What words suggest an offensive? - Sequence to Sequence
- The offensive is targeted at someone? - Binary classification
- The offensive target is an individual, group, or other? - Multi-class classification

I want to avoid create different projects and manage them individually because I want the same person labeling all the tasks at the same moment.
